Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: KanDianYing
Reviews.Content: Zero 1 is a new hotel in downtown Montreal, steps from Chinatown. The location isn't very picturesque, but it's very convenient for meetings or activities downtown. The closest subway station is only a 10 minute walk from there. I found the service very efficient and friendly. I had a room with a queen bed on the 12th floor. It was on the small side, but very modern and clean. The bathroom was immaculate. The breakfast was fine though not extraordinary - a few muffins, juice boxes, coffee. I paid 139 CAD + taxes for 1 night, a decent price for such a hotel. Overall, my experience was very good.

Reviews.Title: “front desk staff superb & great location!”
Reviews.Author: cdbunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights Pros: - The front desk staff couldn't be more courteous if they tried, example of this: got a free valet parking coupon from tripadvisor and was planning to use it, when we checked in, I handed the ticket over and the front desk staff accepted it and noted that there is no problem, but when we got back to the room she informed us nicely that she didn't know we were booking through expedia so the free parking does not apply, normally I would be outraged, but because she was courteous and polite, I was ok with that. - Hotel is opposite China Town, lots of chinese food within walking distance, so the lack of restaurant in the hotel is not a problem at all - Hotel is also walking distance to Vieux Montreal - The room is very modern, bed was comfortable, I am very picky about my bed - They have cutlery, dishes, glasses and microwave in the room, this is very handy since wegot take-out from the chinese restaurant the night before, almost every night Cons: - The convenient location is also its downfall, it's very noisy, I did ask for a room not facing the road and , but looks like they're pretty fully booked so the best we got was on the 8th floor but facing the main road (boul. rene-levesque). On the first night, the cops and fire trucks were going past the main road like 4-6 times until 11pm, then it stopped. Second night, road was quiet other than a few car horns here and there until about 9pm. Third night, not a peep. Now, I'm not sure if it was because we got lucky or if there's some sort of noise restriction on the main road during the night. - One morning the elevator was locked, no matter how many times we pressed the button, wouldn't work, so took the emergency exit. There are two exits, the first one we took, we couldn't open the door leading out to the lobby and now window on the door either. So, we went up to level 3 (level 2's door was locked) and used the other exit, this time it the door to the lobby was unlocked, so we got out, just concerns me a little bit that one emergency exit can be opened. - Valet parking is $23 - Our towels were bit weird, one was thicker than the other, so I always jostled with hubby to get the thicker one Tip: Also, the first night our aircon cycle in and out, because we set the temp at 20degC, we could not get a sleep at all. Our trick so that it's on all the time is to set the temperature at 16degC, the aircon will try to get the temp down to that but won't because it looks like it's set to maintain temp at 20degC, so it will stay on all the time Verdict: Love the hotel, love the location, hate the valet parking fee (but necessary), hate the noise. I'd probably come back if they give me a higher level room not facing the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Downtown Mtl.”
Reviews.Author: Derek L
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, if you don't mind cozy little rooms. Style is very modern, great little complimentary breakfast, (muffins, coffee, juice, etc.) Downtown Montreal right across from China Town a couple of blocks away from the heart of Saint Catherine's and old Montreal. Great reception and service. Very clean and great Bang for your Buck. Oh and you step off the 747 bus from the airport at the corner of Saint Laurent and Renee Levesque and you're facing your hotel. Trip from Airport to Hotel about 30mins.

Reviews.Title: “Good Weekend Spot”
Reviews.Author: Canadaniel
Reviews.Content: Great spot for a weekend that doesn't break the bank. Rooms are nice - small and modern, no room for socializing, but perfect for those who are in town for the weekend and want a clean, modern room to lay their heads. Minor downsides: neighbourhood might scare some folks, and ceiling was painted black, which must be a nightmare for hotel staff to keep looking clean. Highly recommended for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “have a very industrial modern look & close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: celticgirl_PR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a mini romantic week-end get away in our own city. We got a great deal on this hotel, so we didn't go in with high expectations. To our surprise it was one of our best experiences. The rooms have a very industrial modern look. The hotel is small and has a very intimate feel about it. It is nicely decorated in dark tones and wood, with large windows that give you a great view of Chinatown. It is very trendy without being pretentious. The staff was extremely friendly and spoke both English and French (seemed to be alot of vistors from Europe at the time we stayed and they too enjoyed their experience). We had a LOFT suite room right off the elevator on the 9th floor (didn't hear elevator at all). Had a living room area, wall unit, table and then the bed. It was well equipped (Hidden fridge, sink, microwave, real wine glasses, plates and cutlery â€“ which all came in handy for our takeout food we ate in our room. Coffee maker,(2) LCD TVs, and an alarm clock with an IPOD adaptor.) The bathroom was very nice (shower only â€“ no bathtub), the bed was very comfortable, and we had a great view. It had everything we needed and we loved hanging out in the room between activities. So close to Chinatown and Old Montreal. Only downside in the suites it would have been nice to have bathrobes and because we stayed in the winter, and the rooms have dark wood floors when we walked into room with our boots â€“ salt was left behind. Wish we had a mat to place our footwear on. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone headed to Montreal. The subway is also a short walk away. The valet was flat rate of $24 a day (which we did not use â€“ found parking on the street near the hotel and didnâ€™t have to pay for street parking on Sunday). But with the metro/subway so close no need for a car. There is a little corner store â€œdepanneurâ€� connected to hotel if you need wine or beer last minute. If not a 5 minute walk away is a grocery store and liquor store (SAQ). It turned out to be one of the best deals we have ever got on a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, & very trendy”
Reviews.Author: Aroc23
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Hotel Zero 1 and I loved it! My girlfriend and I got a great deal on this hotel, so we tempered our expectations. It turned out to be one of the best deals I have ever gotten on a hotel! The value was amazing. The hotel is small and very intimate. It is nicely decorated in dark colours, with large windows that give you a great view of Chinatown. It is very trendy without being pretentious. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They were always smiling and always very pleasant. We had a regular room. It was well equiped and again very nicely decorated. The bathroom was very nice, the bed was very comfortable, and we had a great view. It was a very small room, but there are suites available. We had all the room we needed! It came with a coffee maker, fridge, plates, wine glasses, LCD TV, and an alarm clock with an IPOD adaptor. It had everything we needed and we loved hanging out in the room between activities. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone headed to Montreal. It was walking distance to a good deal of the best activities Montreal has to offer. The subway is also a short walk away. The valet was flat rate of $23 a day, but the car was kept in a secured underground parking lot and it was very convenient to have the car waiting at the door whenever we wanted to go for a drive. I would come back in a second and likely will sometime in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Zero 1 gets a 10!”
Reviews.Author: Femmedewinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Great choice for those who are visiting Montreal by foot as its perfectly located just steps away from Rue St-Laurent, St-Catherines, close to so many restaurants, bars, etc. The hotel is well-priced, very clean and the rooms have a very industrial modern look. Valet parking price is also reasonable for downtown MTL. Would def go back.

Reviews.Title: “If you love IKEA, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: DellaBME
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on the fifth floor -- the open air terrace on the same floor made our trip. Literally spent hours out there each night. Three blocks from a Metro grocery store attached to an underground mall with a liquor store. Walking distance from the train station as well. Location is right at the gate to Chinatown which was cool. Walked to old Montreal and other neighbourhoods without issue. The room was AWESOME and came with fridge, microwave, ironing supplies, and place settings for two. Would stay again in a heartbeat and have recommended it to others. My only complaint was because we slept in daily -- I had to go down to the front desk to ask to have the room made up, and even when it was pre-arranged, it didn't happen the last day. They need to be more clear about their policies regarding maid service. But other than that? Worth EVERY penny paid. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great design but is lacking some basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: aliahdance
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday in January 2012 in a loft room. Got the room for $92 on the Tuango deal website (Would've been $179 without the coupon). I usually stay at chain hotels so thought this would be different and fun to try. Pros: - Great location: walking distance to everything - Great decor: As some mentioned, very Ikea-ish - Parking: Valet is $25 but if you're staying there on the weekend, you can park on the street for free from 6pm Saturday night to 1pm Sunday (if you're there before and/or after that, you can just put money in the meter) - Good breakfast: was basic but they had good muffins and the orange juice was in a juice box (not from a machine) - Huge windows from floor to ceiling Cons: (a lot of very basic amenities missing) - Shower: There was no curtain or door to the shower entrance so you end up getting part of the bathroom floor wet - Bathroom small: Not much space to put your stuff - No mat at the entrance of the room, so you end up getting the hardwood floor wet and dirty when you come in to the room - TV not where the bed is. It is located in the living room section. - TV not working: It took about 5 minutes to turn it on in the early evening, and then when we came back from dinner and drinks, it wasn't working at all. We called reception and they told us the technical support had gone home for the evening, but that we could switch rooms. We didn't really want to pack up everything and switch at midnight so we just stayed in our room. I might stay here again if I got this room for $92, but definitely wouldn't stay here for $179 per night. I would go to the Days Inn or Candlewood Suites a couple blocks away for $100 and get a bigger and better room.

Reviews.Title: “Budget boutique but needs some wow on the service and some more facilities”
Reviews.Author: Slackbladder
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great designer boutique feel to it. I understand its a refurb of an old hostel and they've done it well. The room was lovely with lots of well used space and nicely furnished in a budget boutique way. ikea ish furniture everywhere. Small kitchenette came in useful. Floor to ceiling windows let a lot of light in, corridors are dark and stark. Tins of charcoal paint seem to be used in the refurb. Facilities are sparse in the hotel. Several small seating areas by reception including an small courtyard area. No restaurant or bar, Just a small breakfast pickup area, Tea/coffee,apple, muffins. There is a roof garden but its just really a smokers area. Location is superb. Across the street from Chinatown, 10 minutes to the old town, couple of blocks to shopping area, airport bus stops across the street. Supermarket a few minutes away as well as a small shopping centre. No great bars or restaurants in the immediate area Service wasnt too great. Reception were ok but did not go out of their way. Friendly enough and did what was expected of them.One day it was blowing a gale and the courtyard doors were slamming and blowing newspapers every where. Nobody even looked up. Lots of other hotels in Montreal to try and would probably do so. Still has bit of hostel feel to it. So wouldnt give it 4 stars. More luxe 2 star. Nothing major to complain about though.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bien”
Reviews.Author: genymart
Reviews.Content: Good location. We when there to see the Dralion show at the bell Center. Design is nice. Not lot of light in the room. We had an room upgrade but even with that we had a double bed and not a queen or King size. Bathroom is very nice. For the parking you need to pay 25$ for the valet or go in a private parking close and walk. For the price this hotel is very good. I will not go there for more then 1 or 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Parfait... ZÃ©ro dÃ©faut !”
Reviews.Author: Aroundtheworld1985
Reviews.Content: Nous avons passÃ© le rÃ©veillon du nouvel an au ZÃ©ro 1 et c'Ã©tait tout simplement : Wow ! Le service, l'accueil, la suite, la vue, etc. tout Ã©tait super ! MÃªme si l'hÃ´tel Ã©tait complet en cette veille du 1er janvier et que les gens Ã©taient sur le party, nous avons trÃ¨s bien dormis. Une seule chose manque cependant : un restaurant. Vu que le quartier chinois est Ã  deux pas, nous avons ramenÃ© un souper-sushis dans notre chambre. Le confort de la suite, les sushis, la bouteille de vin et la vue sur la ville : que demander de plus ? Et pour les restaurants, ce n'est pas les endroits qui manquent dans le quartier. Les rÃ©ceptionnistes nous ont dits que le restaurant de l'hÃ´tel ouvrirait au printemps ou Ã  l'Ã©tÃ© prochain... Nous aurons donc une nouvelle occasion de passer une fin de semaine Ã  MontrÃ©al et ainsi de profiter des festivals Ã  deux pas de l'hÃ´tel dans le quartier des spectacles ! Merci pour ce superbe rÃ©veillon ! On reviendra assuremment !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all the way!”
Reviews.Author: JTsobe
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Montreal and was a bit hesitating about where to stay... Hotel Zero showed up on the list of hotels in downtown and I loved it. The design, the service, the location (very close to everything), etc.. every single thing was outstanding. Our room (Loft category) was amazing, spacious, nice views, lots of closet space and very comfy! Will go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book it!!!”
Reviews.Author: azzaria
Reviews.Content: Totally dirty, can't sleep, too cold, too much noise, freezing bath room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but a bit too pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Marangocamaron
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last July durn the Just for Laughs festival. It was a great location, within walking distance to shops, shows and restaurants. Its a very nice, modern and clean place. The rooms were just really small and really dark, since some of the walls were black. The nice thing about this place that there is a convienience store on the main floor. Its good if you wanted to grab some snack foods of drinks. I would recommend this place if you like a little modern feel.. overall I wouldn't go back just cause you can get a bigger hotel room for for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonColombo
Reviews.Content: Helpful front of the house staff. clean comfortable rooms, great rate and near to old city. Had a problem with the shower but receptionists change me to another room immediately.

Reviews.Title: “very nice simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: james s
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent price from hotels.com and decided to stay here for four nights. The hotel is clean, the staff is friendly and the location is good ( 15 min walk to Old Montreal, 8 minute walk to the metro ). We will stay here again on our next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good find”
Reviews.Author: ladybug269
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at Hotel Zero 1 while going to a show at Place Des Arts. The hotel itself is very modern and funky, which we like. I liked the colors and the layout of the room, again very modern. Bed was very comfy. I thought they did alot with the little space that they have. Check-in was fast and efficient, no problems at all. The room was clean, and comfortable. The only issue i had with the room was the shower. Its rectangular shaped, with the shower head on the long wall, meaning if you facing the shower, your back is almost against the wall. I am a medium sized person and i found it kinda awkward, my husband is a big guy and he found it tight. Its not a deal breaker, just a weird little thing. The hotel does not have its own parking, rather it rents spaces from a nearby shopping centre, valet parking was $23 for 24 hrs, which we thought was pretty good for dt montreal. When we first arrived though, all the spaces in front (20 min max, hotel guests only) were full (which was weird considering there was no one else checking in) so we had to drive in circles to wait for one to free up, and ended up parking illegally! The location is good if your going to a show at Place Des Arts, amaybe a 7 minute walk. It is also direcly across from the enterence to Chian Town. However, the area itself is not very nice. There are 2 strip clubs steps from the hotel and although we didn't hear much street noise, there were several sirens during the night. It is also not great if you goal is shopping on saint catherines street. The street itself is only 5 minutes away, but the shopping section of the street is a 20 minute walk or so. If that is your goal, there are hotels in that direction at the same price point.

Reviews.Title: “Best in its price range”
Reviews.Author: Koopa T
Reviews.Content: We stayed over for a business trip one weekend for around 130/night. This is a no frills hotel executed with style. Our room was a lot smaller than I had anticipated and I'll admit that I was a little dissapointed at first but ended up liking it. Its compact and makes good use of every inch of space. Major pluses: - Dark wood floors instead of carpet - iPod dock - Flat screen T.V. positioned for bed/dining area - Free WiFi, good signal as far as I could tell - Shower w/ good water pressure/temp control - Pretty decent coffee/muffins for breakfast - Kitchenette [looks like a closet but has everything you need] - Overall very cool feel - The biggest thumbs up goes to the staff. They were friendly and helpful when you needed them and didn't bother you otherwise. There was an incident where our neighbours were being extremely noisy and we tolerated it up to a point at which we called front desk. They basically said "Ok. We'll deal with it" and they did in 2 mins flat. Awesome. Will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “noisy but central”
Reviews.Author: 78N
Reviews.Content: we had a room overlooking the street - on the 5th floor it was very noisy, we could hear all the traffic, and the vent was noisy too. very nice surprise to find a full kitchenette in the room - we could have cooked our meals. very nice terrace on the 5th floor,small gym (but nobody used it), very modern, and nicely furbished rooms

Reviews.Title: “Very central location, excellent services”
Reviews.Author: SimonButcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 507 (a "zero 1 pop" room) for 8 nights, which we thought at first was a bit too tiny, but the room is actually very practical. Each room has cable TV, a kitchenette with a microwave, fridge, coffee maker (horrible filtered coffee though, but coffee and muffins are available every morning downstairs almost makes up for it), and its own WIFI router, meaning you can get excellent Internet for free here without it being like free Internet in other hotels where it works so long as your laptop is in the lobby or near the room's door. The staff were friendly but a little detached at times, and we had some concerns given the "seedy" look of the area (the "Quartier des spectacles" is being heavily renovated, it seems) and the fact that the staff often don't seem to even acknowledge your existence as you enter the hotel later at night, but we didn't have a single problem. Bonus points must be awarded for the Couche-Tard (a 24-hour convenience store) located in the same building but on the rear. If you're looking for something more substantial, there's an IGA supermarket in a part of the underground city just west of here a couple of blocks too. Given Montreal's fantastic restaurants I don't know why you'd want to microwave something to eat in the room (we didn't). The hotel's location is perfect - Saint Laurant metro station is five minute's walk (about 10 minutes for Place-d'Armes metro if you prefer), rue Sainte-Catherine Ouest starts at half that distance, China Town starts just across the road (including the excellent Restaurant Beijing, again roughly five minute's walk), and the bus stop for the 747 bus to the airport is practically at the door-step. Take a look on Street-View! The hotel has clearly gone through (and is still going through) a large scale renovation from their old apartment-hotel formula (ignore the horrible looking photos on older reviews), as the rooms are very modern and ours was thoughtfully arranged to utilise the small space efficiently, and they're still working on a new restaurant for the hotel on the ground floor. We did have some minor hammer-drill noise at around 7am on two mornings during our stay (we were awake anyway), but otherwise the rooms really are very sound-proof. As with every hotel I've been to, the room's air-conditioner is too noisy to leave on for very long (and certainly not while sleeping), but the huge advantage here is that the windows can be opened! Other hotels could learn from this, and the fresh air was very welcome. Our room overlooked Boulevard RenÃ© LÃ©vesque so we had to close this at night to keep the noise out, but it was pretty quiet (the windows are double-glazed so it's a very minor din, as can be expected down-town). The sound proofing is very good, and we didn't hear a peep from neighbouring rooms (and we even saw lots of loud girls potentially on a hen-night arrive in two limousines, so we "knew" we'd have a rough night, and still we heard nothing). However, it doesn't allow for much airflow, and unfortunately our room was very dusty. The floors, tables, and even the chairs were very dusty, and the room had a distinct dry, dusty smell. This, combined with the closed window and the noisy air-conditioning meant that the room became very stale but more importantly very dry overnight. I would suggest they dust and vacuum the rooms more often, and if it's still so dry humidify them somehow (we told the front desk and they seemed surprised, so perhaps it's unusual). If the prices and service remains the same as this, I'm sure I would consider staying here again next time I'm in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Superb place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: WilliamN78
Reviews.Content: Really a great hotel. Rooms are large, with modern funky decor. Staff very helpful. Bed comfy. The street to the North is a little run down but I never felt unsafe and the location generally is pretty good, close to the Place des Arts and several Metro stations. On the minus side, the TV is located far away from the bed, at least in my room, so no TV in bed! Also, the restaurant wasn't open so the only breakfast is muffins, juice, fruit and coffee, which as its included in the price isn't too bad really. I would definitely stay here again. Oh - and a great price too!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: HMP375
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 9 nights at this hotel and thought that the hotel and staff were great. The rooms are clean, modern and functional; the front desk staff and other service staff, without exception, were charming and helpful. Unlike a previous visitor, I didn't have any trouble explaining myself in English! I agree that the rooms are rather dark, and could benefit from a desk light for those visitors who need to work and read. I was there on business and used the internet every day and had no problems at all. If I were to make any suggestions, it would be to get a good news channel (eg: BBC News 24) to complement the collection of rubbish pap TV on offer. Also, I couldn't get the radio to work, but I didn't try very hard! I did have a bit of trouble with the air con, which seemed to stop working; the front of house staff sent someone to sort it out immediately (but it did recur). The hotel is indeed in an area which is on the boundary of a rather less salubrious quarter; on one evening, I planned to take the 'Lonely Planet' walk up to the Latin Quarter, and turned back after a couple of blocks, as it was clearly rather dodgy. As in any town, you just need to use your head when choosing where to go: I felt no anxiety walking alone (i am female) at night up from the Old Town or Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but NO internet (falsely marketed as "free" internet)”
Reviews.Author: JCMPBrooklyn_NY
Reviews.Content: The hotel is contemporary and nicely designed. And the staff was generally very friendly and helpful. However the internet does not work at all (admittedly by some staff, a common problem). Although you can initially connect, you get kicked off every 5 minutes +/-. The only help the staff gave after numerous calls was "try rebooting the router" and "really? it should work..." (UHM, OBVIOUSLY!). Otherwise there was no concession or sympathy... SO if you require online connectivity, do not stay at this hotel. Also the "gym" is an extremely small room (maybe 10feet by 10feet +/-?) with one treadmill, one elliptical, one stationary bike, and one cable home gym. There are no free weights and this small exercise room is extremely uncomfortable to work out in if you are not alone. Accordingly I had to spend another $15/day (per person) to workout at a local gym. Many other hotels have more complete gyms included so those who are physically active should strongly consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: crazyowleyes22
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews and price (this also was a last minute vacation so we were trying to quickly find a good hotel in short amount of time). Location was good theoretically, in walking distance to Old Montreal, subway station and St Catherine Street. However, the immediate area seemed dingy. It wasnâ€™t far to walk to St Catherine Street but then you really have to walk a fair bit to get to the part of the street with all the shops and cafes/restaurants. Our room overlooked Rene-Levesque St and the view was of China town entrance and a dirty carpark (many random people hung out in that carpark at various times of the day and night. My partner was looking out the window one day and noticed a guy peeing on a parked car... lovely). We saw nicer areas towards the other end of town (which also were within good distance to Old Montreal and St Catherine street and public transport). Hotel seemed like it was nice but basic, good for those on a budget. Unfortunately, the major downside for me was that the rooms were so dark (dark paint, poor lighting). One light near the door good for getting in and out of the room only, one main light over the table (but the light barely extended to the bed) and one bedside table lamp. The light in the bathroom was much brighter than in the main room. Bedside lamp only provided enough light for that side of the bed. I understand that it gives the room atmosphere but it was so impractical and just plain annoying. The reception staff will get an extra lamp delivered to the room if asked (and it seemed like a common request from their reaction when I asked). Other than that, room was satisfactory, clean and comfortable enough, the bathroom was modern (but small and not enough room to store your toiletries on the washbasin without constantly knocking them off), also has a mini kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Kaihawki
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zero 1 is officially my new favorite hotel in Montreal! First off location. Zero 1 is conveniently located between the shopping street of St. Catherine's, the lounge and restaurant street of St. Laurent, the top edge Old Montreal and just a few blocks away from the Gay Village. You can't get a much better location than that. Now top onto the location the amazingly chic decor and feel to the interior of this building and you have a great match up. The rooms are ultra-modern and stylish along with the lobby and 5th floor open roof top patio. Comfy beds, flat screens, lots of storage, cool lighting and lots of mirrors add to the trendy feel of this hotel. A light breakfast is provided in the lobby each morning, the WiFi is free and on top of this the Airport 747 Express Bus to downtown stops right beside the hotel ($8 - One way trip direct to airport, about 30mins). Views are great from the top floors and I found the hotel quite sound proof. Ipod docks and small kitchenettes were a great touch too. Staff were friendly, outgoing and spoke both french and english. The gym is small but provides the basic essentials. There are lots of meeting rooms here if you are planning a conference or event. The icing on the cake was the price, it was only $129 a night (when I booked) which made for unbelievable value. To be honest, I could live in that hotel for a month and not get tired of it. I really recommend you stay at this hotel, I will be staying here next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Funky does not always mean good”
Reviews.Author: claudia155019
Reviews.Content: We are an adult couple over 50, booked 2 nights and chose the hotel based on reviews. Big mistake. That is why I decided to write my first review ever to help people to look closer when booking a place to stay even for one night. No matter how funky or modern a hotel room is it should never lack comfort. Yes, it's all decorated in black and grey but you still need enough light to find your things around and be able to fire up your PC. Dark and depressing room!Yes the bathroom was nice and modern but you don't need to bump into walls to move from sink to the shower. The duvet and pillow shams had stains, we asked to be replaced , the toilet did not flush properly (bad plumbing for a new hotel!) There were only two plastic seats and a small table in the room. no real chairs to relax in, no desk, a very low table with a missing leg serving as the only piece of furniture to store something on, a very small closet not full height, suitable for one person. No coat rack or at least some hooks at the entrance- that was really a big miss. The laminate flooring was cheap and squeaky, the only rug in the room was the one they use at the Mall entrance.The most idiotic thing was the location of the wall mounted TV, right in the small entry hallway, across the bathroom, 16ft away from the bed and the plastic chairs. Everything looked like designed by a blind and drunk individual. Moving from comfort to safety, how can the only sprinkler in this unit be placed in the bathroom?? As a construction engineer I can say without any doubts that the hotel was built cheap and with no idea of comfort. Won't ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is worth a try”
Reviews.Author: proulx
Reviews.Content: We are two adults that needed to spend one night in Montreal and we decided to give this hotel a try. We are most satisfied and had a most enjoyable stay. Rooms are compact but include a lot and are just a bit short from a full efficiency appartment and much more comfortable than a pure hotel room. The price was right as well compared to hotel prices and the location was fine. The street is a bit noisy but you are in downtown Montreal and we got used to the street level noise. We also appreciated the valet service for parking off location, the staff was most competent and they did inform us that we should plan 30 minutes ahead if we needed our vehicle and it did take some 30 minutes to retrieve our vehicle. We would definitively go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Malou0
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best deal in Montreal. The hotel is vxery modern, the rooms are georgous w/ superb city vie and the hotel is close to everything.The only downside was that there was dust and glass stains on the bedside table. It is also slightly noisy.All in all, excellent stay. Excellent value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “front desk is uninformed”
Reviews.Author: charu s
Reviews.Content: I cheked in on thursday and left on sunday. The hotel charged my cc twice and I am still trying to work out for a refund. they do not understand anything but french very clearly. So my advise is to go some place where the front desk can understand English.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - lack of attention and follow through on complaints”
Reviews.Author: DominiqueC27
Reviews.Content: We were impressed when we arrived at this boutique hotel.Ideal position,close to Metro,buses and airport express next to hotel.Central to downtown,old Montreal and very walkable. The refreshing cucumber,mint water and apples in a big spoon at reception ,little nooks with funky couches and an atrium to sit in , a convenience store with most the things you need are great pluses... However, overworked frazzled front desk staff....lack of follow up... Our room key didn't work 3 times,no apology. The A/C was so loud we couldn't watch TV . We opened the window but had no blind to keep the room cool and had to deal with the trucks offloading outside our window day and night . Day 2/4 brought a blind that went down and that was it. We finally had it taken down. Our room wasn't cleaned on the first day as we got back late afternoon and we too tired to go out again for them to clean. The second day I called them to do it at 3pm , day 3 we got back at 4 room not done. There was nowhere to hang towels.I reported it 3 times!!! We were offers to move rooms on the 3rd night but to a smaller room. I complained again to Emily who apologized and said she would speak to the duty manager and would send someone to fix the problems.... This couldnt be done though the maintenance guy did come and had not been informed of all the challenges. The room was to be serviced when we went out for dinner but the cleaner came saying that he was off duty at 5.30.I wanted to scream.... We are very disappointed at the disjointed systems and procedures. There seems to be no efficient management and housekeeping follow up .... Spoilt what could have been a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: greenmountains1
Reviews.Content: i had a wonderful visit to the hotel ZERO 1.I wrote a review earlier,however it never seemed to be posted so here i go again.The room was modern and perfect for my needs with a microwave,sink and fridge.The staff is outstanding and it is very clean.I especially enjoyed the bathroom and the awsome shower.Zero 1 is centrally located,it was so easy to walk to everything I wanted to see.I travel here yearly and was very impressed at the changes to my favorite hotel,in my favorite city.I will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic with great location”
Reviews.Author: HPMC
Reviews.Content: Lovely modern hotel with a great location. Less than 10 minute walk from Place des Arts (where major events are held), 10 minute walk to the gay village, a quick bike ride to Parc du Mont Royal via BIXI (which we loved though still not as great as compared to the European bike services), 3 seconds from China Town (just outside it in fact) and less than 10 minutes to Old Montreal. Amenities were good and we had an insuite Kitchenette. The hallways on the floors leading to rooms however were VERY dark. (Typical of these modern hotels). Parking is not cheap and valet service only and they ask for up to 30 minutes to get your car. You can park in lots around the city that are close by but I wonder how safe it is? Bed was super comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and the staff at the front desk were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel with Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: cambria81
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zero 1 is a great pick for a weekend get-away! The hotel itself it really nice, modern and clean. It gives you the 5 star feeling without spending the money. We had a King room on the 9th floor (903) with a great view! The room was real nice & clean, but a little small - we didn't spend too much time there so it wasn't an issue. It had a wet bar with fridge, 42" flat screen & clean, modern washroom. You cannot beat the location! Its a 5 minute walk to old montreal and minutes away from St. Catharine Street (lots of shopping, restaurants and bars). Be sure to visit the terrance on the 5th floor, it over looks the city and is a great place to relax after a long day of site seeing! The staff is very friendly and helpful, although the lobby was always busy they were very quick to accomodate. The valet parking is speedy and convient. The only downfall is its $24/night. Which seems to be the same at every hotel in the area. I will definitely stay here the next time Im in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find - trendy comfort, near EVERYTHING in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: desimport
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best finds of the year! Great rooms, neatly laid out, with super comfortable beds, amazing closets, and a shower stall that rocks. The continental breakfast was an excellent start before walking to Old Montreal, and exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and didn't apologise”
Reviews.Author: FoodForFunk
Reviews.Content: I booked in advance for one night through bookings.com, but when I arrived (after 24 hours travelling) I was told that "there was a problem with the toilet in my room" - this is hotel-speak for having overbooked. So - first off, they lied to me about already renting my booked room. They had booked me in to another hotel, of course - but they failed to apologise for the situation, and they also failed to offer me a taxi ride to the other place. All they offered me was a glass of water!! So I had to walk for 15 minutes, with all my luggage, through an unfamiliar city, at 10:30pm, to get to the other hotel. I've never been treated as badly, even by $3 hotels in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Great, funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kose
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Zero 1 last minute for a weekend getaway in Montreal. The location was great. We were able to walk to many attractions. The hotel is very modern with funky, chic decor. Having a mini kitchen in the room was amazing (fridge, sink, dishes etc.) We also enjoyed lounging on the rooftop patio. Housekeeping was a little bit behind on Sunday and our room wasn't made up until 5pm which was a bit frustrating as we wanted to rest after a long day of sight-seeing in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: WriteoPDX
Reviews.Content: A room about as big as a breadbox. And why they couldn't put in heavier windows to block street noise is beyond me. But having said that, the room layout was efficient & included a fridge, coffee maker & free internet. Breakfast (croissant, fruit, yogurt, coffee) was included. The neighborhood can feel sketchy but it's convenient to everything, including right at a stop to the express airport bus ($8), a real convenience. The whole hotel is nonsmoking -- except, it seems, the great outside terrace on the 5th floor. Or maybe just not enforced there.

Reviews.Title: “good with a few hiccups”
Reviews.Author: someguy90
Reviews.Content: bad: pretty sketchy neighborhood that near but only for a block that behind the hotel - some towels have stains -some dirt in small crevasses like between the bed and frame for me there were bread crumbs in my room - lots of spiders/web on the window all on the outside but some webs in the rooms too very few though -missing room sign (do not disturb, cleaning service) good: GREAT LOCATION--- in the middle of downtown. everything is in walking distance about 10-25 mins -pretty cheap - Really comfy bed/pillow -nice looking rooms. modern interior, nice to have a mini kitchenette -lots of different food places near by -chinatown is right across the street -grocery store near by unknown: didn't really have to call room service/customer service (front desk people were nice from the interactions that i had with them) - restaurant was not open yet -didn't wake up to try the continental breakfast overall: 3 1/2 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, central location”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangirl02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights before a wedding that we had to attend. Since every hotel in Montreal is over $200 a night in the summer time, I came across this one and decided to take a chance at only $130 a night. When we first got there, late at night, almost 1am, we decided to walk around the neighbourhood. When you go back behind the hotel (opposite way of Old Montreal), it's a very Sketchy area!!! Drugs....women of the night...all of this is going on, so I was actually scared! The hotel itself was nice though. The next day we found our way to Old Montreal, which is so quick to get too and we also walked to the downtown in about 25 minutes. The rooms were clean and very different with the black walls, and the beds were comfortable. The shower was a bit small and oddly shaped, but service was fairly good as well. So all in all, I would stay here again 100%. For the price - you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “First time here, and we would definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: jpsgirl96
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to Montreal for the past year, on business with some pleasure thrown in, and have stayed in three different hotels. It was a busy time for the city, with many hotels booked up, so we decided to take a chance on the relatively new Zero 1. The rate was excellent, and the location (near Chinatown and several different Metro stations) very good (yes, some of the surroundings are still in transition, but we were very comfortable in the neighborhood). Though the hotel is still working out some challenges (with the valet parking, on a VERY busy corner), we found the service very friendly and helpful, the room (yes, they are painted black - I'm sure they will get over that at some point!) quite comfortable and spacious enough to work, sleep and enjoy an evening cocktail, and the breakfast foods well done - especially since they provide "to go" cups and little bags for the pastries, etc. We will stay again when we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “IKEA-ish designed hotel in a perfect location, great price, will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: whitkeys
Reviews.Content: After searching high and low on the internet for the perfect Montreal hotel for our vacation, I chose Hotel Zero based on the price, location and over-all design. The hotel was even nicer than I expected. The location is beyond excellent, right below St. Catherine's street, and less than a 10 minute walk to the shops and bars on St. Denis. As some reviews stated it is near the "red light district"; yes there are strip clubs nearby on St. Catherine's, but if you know anything about Montreal, they stretch throughout downtown. This hotel is not closer than any other hotels to them. The rooms themselves were tastefully designed--very IKEA-ish, with an all white platform bed (very comfortable duvet and pillows), flat screen TV, small table with two chairs, and a large yellow-tinted mirror on the wall. The view was amazing from the 9th floor room, a panoramic city view--we could even see the fireworks from the water at night (not quite sure what the occasion for them was). The bathroom was a shower only, but was so thoughtfully designed, with a removable shower head and a large in shower mirror against the wall. A nice hairdryer and toiletries were provided. The kitchenette is hidden behind dark brown doors upon entering the room, and is equipped with a sink, plates, cups, wine glasses, coffeemaker, silverware and napkins, a cutting board, wine key, microwave and mini refrigerator. The room couldn't have been better, we had our own thermostat which worked great and the soundproofing in the room was excellent, we never heard anything outside of our room (maybe we just had quiet neighbors?). The only complaint I had was the wireless internet. Each room has its own router, but it is a crappy one. I was unable to connect using my iphone, so we resorted to hardwiring the laptop with the ethernet cable. After doing so, it worked fine. Not a big deal (And yes, we tried turning the router on/off several times). The patio area on the fifth floor is nice, though we never spent time out there, it was crowded with people smoking at night. The hotel is connected to a 24 hour convenience store which is accessed near the lobby down a lit hallway. The bar is still being built, but we didn't have any complaints as we brought alcohol from the home and kept it in the fridge since it's cheaper ;) Stay here if you come to Montreal. We would definitely stay here again if/when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: seattle_cdn
Reviews.Content: This is a NICE hotel. Super new and newly renovated. Hotel Zero-1 looks like it was once a hostel but is renovated to be a full service hotel. It is conveniently located on Rene Levesque and St. Laurent, so the Airport express bus stops very close to it, and you can easily walk up St. Laurent to get to anywhere that matters in Montreal. The lobby is very hip and the check-in staff are very helpful and down to earth. Each room is very nicely furnished with modern furniture, colourful lighting but the rooms have a dark finish that is more night clubby. Each room has its own kitchenette with a sink, microwave and fridge so you have a place to heat up your leftovers and even entertain. The IP phone system means you can make free long distance calls anywhere in the world. I asked the staff if they would ever change it and they said "we figure the cost is covered when you come to stay here next". Great philosophy. The technology support is great. Each room has its own wireless router, although upload rates seem quite slow. Breakfast is great too. Complimentary assortment of fruit, yogurt, and pastries. The Muffins are some of the best muffins I've ever had, seriously. There is a gym, but it's not much to write home about. I wouldn't ding them for it but I wish they had some free weights. There's a nice deck with a great view on the 5th floor. South facing rooms have a much better view of the skyline of Old Montreal. Ask to be put in one of those. Just awesome awesome value. I'm a huge fan.

Reviews.Title: “We Love this place”
Reviews.Author: madfordr
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel in May of 2010. It hadn't at that time changed owners and we liked it so we were really surprised when we returned Canada Day weekend. We felt it to have an elegant touch. The white decor was really nice.We expected the kitchenette area,minus the stove that was there last year,but we didnt missit. The continental breakfast was a welcome surprise. there was coffee, fruit ,muffins,yogurt,juices,it was very nice.They also have a bowl of fresh fruit in the lobby (nice) All of the staff were very nice and accomodating,the front desk staff was very helpful.We were told that they only took over two months ago and when we come back next year,it'll be even better and I believe them. My daughter and I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “needs to be run with much more professionalism if it does not want to drop down quickly on the ratings”
Reviews.Author: tritam
Reviews.Content: nice ideas but realised on the cheap/ sloppy cleaning. used plastic cups on the reception desk , carpet in hallways, entry and elevator is vey dirty. Minimal mattress cover sheets, no bedside table lamps. Common areas, entry and elevatator are unkempt and ate clearly not ckeaned on a regular basis. This is the first impression when you walk in. Looks nice on the pictures, shiny at first glance, but the attention to detail, lack of adequate staff training, using professional vacuum cleaners that have good filters and do not project the dust back into the room need to be adressed urgently. Otherwise call yourself a youth hostel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price !!!”
Reviews.Author: maplesyrup821
Reviews.Content: I booked four nights at Zero 1 and was very satisfied with my choice. The room was huge and very clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. The only negative points are the slow internet and the fact that there is not enough light in the room. Also, it was difficult to set the temperature on the air-con system. The location is great, just near the St-Laurent metro. Would definitely go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, good value, strange location.”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: We needed a reasonably priced room for a conference in Monteral, and the Zero 1 was the lowest price option available for 3*+. The entire hotel had only been open a week or so, and the place was rank with the smell of paint. They painted the whole place black, including the rooms.. which is a bit of a downer in the dark hallways. The hotel only has two elevators, each at opposite ends of the hotel. Only one was operational when we were there, and was full of construction dirt and dust. The room itself was a decent size, with IKEA-esq furniture. It had a good sized mini-fridge and a flat screen tv, which was a plus. The downside to this hotel is the front desk staff and the location. The front desk is VERY small, even for a small hotel. There is only the ability to check one guest in at a time because they only had one computer at the small desk. We had to wait 20 minutes in line to check-in. The location of the hotel is just odd. Its far from the rail station, but "in between" in terms of areas you would want to be. Its a somewhat short walk to the Latin Quarter, but kind of a seedy walk at the same time. We ended up moving to the Hyatt Regency for the final days in Montreal as it was marginally more expensive but a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to love, tough to hate”
Reviews.Author: thisnameisnttaken
Reviews.Content: Pros: Looks good, comfortable beds, free and fast Internet access, free light breakfast, kitchenette. Cons: It's not done yet, location, design instead of function, inconsistent housekeeping, security of building. Tough to love or hate this place. It's stylish in an IKEA and black paint sort of way. Our bed was comfortable, and the front desk staff was pleasant. Breakfast of muffins, fruit, yogurt, juices, and hot beverages was very good. Microwave and fridge in room a plus. However, as others have stated, the location is at the fringe of a neighborhood that may not be expected when booking a trendy, boutique hotel. Windows shades let in a lot of ambient light. Housekeeping, in our case, consisted of bringing more towels, making up the bed, and calling it a day. Soap was never replaced (4-day stay), and floor was rarely, if ever, swept. Dished piled in sink for 2 days. No reading lights. Bathroom poorly equipped -- no real shelf, and only 2 small towel hooks. Workers are still finishing meeting rooms and final touches in common areas. Maybe the building gets locked up after we were in for the night, but from what we saw the front and side doors were unlocked and the elevator never required us to swipe our key card for floor access. There is no restaurant (which many sites list as a current feature) but they say there will be one this autumn. Most travel sites have this classified as a 3 or 3.5 star property, but I struggle to see how it qualifies.

Reviews.Title: “Gave our suite away”
Reviews.Author: The_Doctor01
Reviews.Content: My friends and I reserved a "Living" suite to celebrate my 40th birthday. When we showed up to check in, however, we learned that they had given our suite away to another customer and were just going to give us a normal room. We complained, but the staff said there were no more large suites available. The staff were apologetic and put us in a much smaller, mini-suite, along with an extra room. The mini-suite had poor temperature control, however, and was very hot. Overall very upsetting. Otherwise very chic-looking hotel, clean, staff pretty friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sarjod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Zero 1 for 3 nights, June 2-5. We got a great deal by using a promo code we were sent for it's opening so we definitely got our moneys worth. The 747 bus from the airport dropped us off right across the street from the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helped us whenever we had a question. The room was wonderful, mind you people have said they are a little small but we had no issues with it and if you want a bigger room I guess just pay for the next one up from the basic :) They are very chic rooms, the beds were comfortable, we loved the kitchen space, the large closet and flat screen TV. We went out on the terrace for a bit which was nice, and the convenient store attached to the hotel was awesome. There are still a few areas of the lobby etc that are not completely finished but we didnt mind it didnt interfere with our trip at all. The hotel is in walking distance from Old Montreal and the Port which was great, and it's just a bus ride or subway down to the peel/crescent street area. We bought 3 day metro passes which covered the 747 back to the airport sunday and unlimited subway and bus use which was useful since we went to the Biodome and Olympic Tower on the subway. We thought the location was convienent in getting around but be warned it can seem sketchy at times. A large homeless population in the vicinity yet were were never bothered once by one person but i can see how some people might be put off. I live in Toronto and you are going to get this in any city really so if you are too scared you might as well stay home. Overall we loved the hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Zero Describes It”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtravler2
Reviews.Content: No parking and no written directions given, had to ask for directions and help, zero info in room about hotel or Montreal, Zero atmoslphere, Zero sound proof from window very loud, area was sketchy with questionable people walking around, water ran off the walls in bath after taking shower, no towel racks to put towels and no counter space to put towels, grout not finished with wood spacers still in, cleaning staff never removed dirty dishe they also did not vacume room, no rack or place to put suitcase had to keep on floor, windows in common areas dirty, carpets in common areas dirty, front desk people nice but not to helpful, a dorm room experiece describes this hotel at best from a very seasond traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kamyab1999
Reviews.Content: We went there for the long weekend, The room was beautiful and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The price in unbeatable, Location is amazing, 10-15 min walk from old Montreal and 5 min walk to St. Catherin. If you like to have a really good brunch, the place is call eggspectation. It is also close, about 10 min drive to the Casino. Every room (on 12th and 11th floor had its own Modem), so you have a fast wireless network. Will definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, great hospitality, unbelievable price”
Reviews.Author: roaming-wifi
Reviews.Content: Not only was this hotel perfectly situated for our particular visit it was the only place offering standard rates over the Formula 1 Grand Prix weekend in June 2010. At $133USD, this was a bargain. The room was basic, with no decoration whatsoever, but it met our needs, it had a bed, a shower and a loo. The hotel is at the entrance to Chinatown, within walking distance to Old Montreal and in the opposite direction are the arty districts and underground shopping centres. It really is in an awesome location. The metro station is only a couple of blocks away and there are many buses (including the airport express line) on the doorstep of the hotel. Thereâ€™s also an IGA supermarket one block away which was handy for some Grand Prix snacks. The hotel staff were helpful and polite even though they spoke broken English. I found myself chatting to a nice man in the coin operated laundry of the hotel about all things Montreal, who ended up being the General Manager, Phil! Heâ€™s obviously very proud of his hotel and his city and mentioned that they are working on renovating the hotel one floor at a time. The foyer was already completed when we were there in June and was pretty funky and modern. I would most definitely stay at this hotel in the future. The price, location and hospitality are absolutely right. Thank you Phil!

Reviews.Title: “i go back whenever i can”
Reviews.Author: flandaz
Reviews.Content: I travel to montreal often for leisure, and i always check availability here first. The location is great; one block from grocery, a few blocks from the metro, lots of chinatown restaurants nearby. They have a convenience store in the building, where they sell beer and wine until 11pm. The hotel is unique; modern, minimalist. The basic rooms are not huge, but clean. The more expensive rooms are larger. The rooms have a kitchenette, stocked with pans, microwave, minifridge and utensils, which comes in handy. There is a flat-screen tv mounted on the wall, and a desk. I find the staff friendly, never had any problems. Overall, it's priced well and is a cool place to stay. The kitchenette and grocery store comes in handy for longer stays for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget price hotel”
Reviews.Author: wargtripper
Reviews.Content: Le 1 Rene Levesque won't win many travel awards, but it's a hidden gem. Very well located and very competitively priced, it offers clean self catering accommodation. The rooms aren't the biggest, but they aren't the smallest either (the proverbial cat can be swung)... the furniture is a bit ikea, but that's not so bad (hell, i have some ikea stuff at home). free internet, affordable laundry, a good cheap shop onsite, no huge noise. not luxury, but good no frills fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: megan499247
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice. Has a stove top, fridge and microwave so no need to go out for every meal. Bed was nice and great view. Staff were very nice and helpful. Store downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “IKEA style room, good value for location and price.”
Reviews.Author: Labrador27
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly. Room definitely had a dorm room feel to it. Within walking distance to most downtown Montreal shopping/attractions. No parking. Could use more lighting in bathroom and towel racks that didn't fall off wall. Hotel seemed to be on border with a good area of downtown and a bad area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price. Very nice and...”
Reviews.Author: Sieb123
Reviews.Content: Great location & price. Very nice and helpfull staff. Simple room but with small kitchen with fridge & microwave. Shuttlebus from airport stops in front.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return again.”
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is clean. The front desk was polite and very helpful. The hotel is located right across from Chinatown, and near to the old Montreal, and downtown. Very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Massive construction. Staff should try to sleep here! Should be closed.”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Was intrigued by the ratings of this hotel and felt like testing it out. Having stayed at 75+ hotels since 2007, â€œLe 1â€� is easily the worst on the list. Hereâ€™s the lowdown: Pros: Right on the doorstep to Chinatown. Nice outdoor sitting area on the 5th floor. Some rooms (floors 10-12 on the south side) will have a decent view of Chinatown. Kitchenette was a nice idea; I appreciated the mini-fridge and large work table. Good shower pressure and hot water came within 15 seconds. Windows provide moderate soundproofing from the street. Cons: This is the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed at, and sadly, it could have all been avoided with some common sense from the hotel. There is massive construction going on throughout the 2nd floor. They are ripping the concrete apart and installing new concrete walls for new condos. It starts at 8AM sharp and continues until 7PM. Intense non-stop drilling sounds like someone is using a chainsaw in your room, even several floors above. For a moment I thought this was a practical joke. I couldnâ€™t even hear the TV at full volume. Any normal hotel that values customer satisfaction would be closed for this level of construction. Given the degree of work ahead as of May 2010, I would expect the project to continue until at least late 2010, though likely well into 2011. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED: Donâ€™t expect much sleep anytime in 2010 at this place. Even with earplugs, I left with a sore back and a massive headache. With the big dig of Ste. Catherine, much of the traffic is re-routed to Rene Levesque, where all four lanes of the main street directly in front of the hotel are extremely busy all hours of the day; expect to hear a plethora of horns and sirens, especially if you are unlucky enough to be on the lower floors. I would advise the owner and staff to try sleeping in their hotel to get a sense for the misery their customers must face. Donâ€™t be fooled by the (misleading) curb appeal and renovated lobby; there is absolutely ZERO comfort here. In fact, virtually everything seems to be intentionally designed to make a person want to leave the moment they arrive! Requested a quiet room with a view of Chinatown on a slow day and was given the 4th floor. Check-in was very slow and has a bizarre room contract, which among other things states that no parking service is provided; youâ€™re on your own finding a spot, and given the sketchy area, you will be facing a hike in finding a safe place. The hotel is surrounded by an unsavory blend of shady beggars, hardened inner-city youth and vagrants who camp out 24/7. With all the dark alleys and red light district nearby, walking alone at night would not be recommended here. Absolutely no functionality or practicality in the rooms here. Room itself resembles a hospital; concrete walls and ceiling (some painted, some not, much of it chipped), cold tiled floors that have been dusted but not thoroughly cleaned in weeks, coupled with a vague, musty smell. Only one (!) towel provided. One large, lumpy pillow. Sheets are dated, paper-thin and falling apart. Bed cover looks to be 30 years old. No alarm clock. Poor lighting. One small bar of soap provided. No information on hotel services (which are minimal, though I did find the neat patio on the 5th floor and PCs/washers/dryers and a foosball table on the 6th), no channel guide, no maps or magazines of Montreal etc. Tiny 1980s 13â€� no-name TV in far corner is unwatchable from the bed; thus can only be seen from the one hard, uncomfortable plastic chair. Total new value of all in-room furniture would be around $75; with economies of scale, Le 1 would have paid much less. Oddly, each room has a full-sized dishwasher for the ONE spoon, fork, knife, cup and bowl provided. In 2010, how remarkably environmentally unfriendly, not to mention illogical. Given the profound lack of comfort, you wonâ€™t want to eat in your room anyways. No iron. No drawers for clothes. Mold and cracking tiles in bathtub. Arrived to a boiling-hot room set at 24 degrees, but quickly learned why. Upon setting it to a normal 21 degrees, the room was absolutely freezing at night, rendering the unit completely ineffective. Impractical translucent light beige blinds allow in 90% of the light, meaning your room will be bright and heating up quickly at the crack of dawn, and all south beds are arranged such that they directly face the sun. No eatery in the hotel, and nothing within the block. This is as basic and no-frills as a hotel gets. Lobby is very tight; if anyone is checking in or out, youâ€™ll be dodging their bags to get to the one lone elevator that services 12 floors (notice the minimalist ONE of everything theme at Le 1?). Vibrant downtown nightlife is 15 blocks west, or a good 30-minute walk. At an average rate of $122, this is remarkably poor value for your money for what is essentially an uncomfortable hostel. I have a hard time figuring out why there are so many positive reviews here; from what I saw at Le 1, it would seem that many are backpacking/student/budget travelers with modest standards. My advice? Pay the extra $20-40 (yes, thatâ€™s all, and in some cases less) and stay at one of Montrealâ€™s many beautiful 3-4 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A strange place - but a good experience”
Reviews.Author: OttawaAli
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in a Studio room with a single bed as was attending the Just for Laughs Festival. Room was $75, and although relatively small compared to a traditional hotel room, I had a good stay. The room had an IKEA like desk, side table, cupboard, a large TV and a small kitchenette (including a fridge) all of which seemed relatively new, but didnâ€™t provide much storage space. The room had AC, a good view and the bed was fine (although only had 1 pillow), so provided a comfortable stay. The rooms are a little strange as you feel like youâ€™re in a painted concrete box (no wallpaper, curtains, carpet or pictures on the walls), and feel a bit like they are university dorm rooms. It can take a while to get used to seeing the imperfections in the way the concrete has set, and the rooms feel like they were rushed in completion (the AC control panel on the wall was fixed at an angle as were some of the power sockets). The hallways give an industrial type feel, with pipes exposed, and can be slightly confusing to navigate (you canâ€™t walk completely around a floor). For an overnight or short stay the hotel is fine, the location is great (close to the Metro, Chinatown, supermarket, lots of restaurants and bars, and only 15 minutes walk from the central train station) and the price very good. Bad points â€“ Although a good location, the hotel is in the seedier end of city, so not family friendly! The rooms donâ€™t have much room for storage or to move around in and can feel very small. Given thereâ€™s only one lift for each part of the hotel, it can be quite a wait during busier times. Good points â€“ The hotel has a 24/7 convenience store which stocks a large range of drinks and snacks and a large supermarket (IGA) is less than a block away, so you can cook in your room if you donâ€™t fancy eating out. The price canâ€™t be beaten for the location. The bed was comfortable and TV had lots of channels. For a 2-star hotel the quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Rhe best value for your dollar, no question.”
Reviews.Author: Casualtraveller2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for the second time in a year. If you want and expect a grand ostentatious foyer, chandeliers, spriral staircases, bell boys with cap, valet service, an indoor pool and spa.....you won't find it here. You will find this at a downtown hotel for 2 to 3 times the price. If that is what you want, then there are plenty nearby to rent instead. But if you want affordable, no frills, comfortable clean accomodations next to attractions if you only want to spend as little time boxed in your room and spend most of your time outside doing something this great city has to offer, then 1 RenÃ© Levesque is well worth some serious consideration. This hotel's rate offers a superb value that includes, among others and within a 3 block distance: an underground safe parking lot; St. Catherine street and St. Laurent's restaurants and bar/grills and it's very well attended and very late nightliffe; Chinatown; the underground Metro; an on-site Bixi public bike station, the Montreal pool room (c.1912) and the entry to Old MontrÃ©al waits for you after a 15 minute walk. A friendly front desk staff can help you find interest points in town and serve you in, at least, french and english. The rooms are: very clean; equipped kitchenettes; comfortably spacious with beds that my chronically bad back adored; with big window spaces that also have impressive soundproof qualities; ample work space; new flat screen TVs; lots of towels; excellent supply of water, hot or cold. Also included in this facility is: an outside rooftop terrace on the 5th floor with a pleasant open view; a 24hr convenience store on the first floor; meeting rooms; a Â¾ glassed-in open ceiling centre room on the first floor; an in-house modern laundry room; upcoming nearby world attractions currently under construction. It is offering rooms purchased as condominiums so there is some light construction and sales traffic in the hotel converting and redesigning rooms into ones that are refurbished and quite attractive. You can't beat the location. The reception desk and area is currently small and is undergoing changes as well to better accomodate it's clientele. It is also located near areas where there is broad spectrum of classes of people that cities attract so you can expect to Â«bumpÂ» into anyone. Overall, it's suits what I want and need without breaking the bank. If I want anything with more frills, with more glitter and shine and with some ornate woodwork, with more bells and whistles, with some smoke and mirrors, and Â«aux fesses tightÂ», then I'll go somewhere else and spend alot more.

Reviews.Title: “They don't want to be in the hotel business, and it shows.”
Reviews.Author: Insouciant1
Reviews.Content: WARNING: This is a badly run hotel, in the process of being converted to condos. Ownership obviously doesn't care about the quality of the guests' experience. Our room was barren and cold -- no coverings on the linoleum floor, no decor on the raw concrete walls. The air conditioning controls didn't work -- it was too cold all the time. No hot water for the shower some of the time. This place made a state-college dorm room look attractive. Think of a low-grade pension in an Eastern-bloc country. And we had one of the "best" rooms in the place -- top floor, largest size. We asked if we could swap for a more comfortable room, even if smaller, and were told that all rooms are the same except for size. Also, it is no bargain. We payed $200 for a weeknight and $300 for a Friday night. Perhaps some gouging going on due to high demand that weekend, but shop around before you agree to pay that much for a room that would be fair value at $75 or less. On the bright side, the location is great, and the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place but beware of your personal belongings”
Reviews.Author: Santorini-0123
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is convenient and rates are affordable. However, you must be very careful of your personal belongings when you stay there. There are numerous cases of clients' personal properties which disappear like magic. If you happen to forget a personal belonging in your room when you check out, you will never see it again. The hotel reception or administration will tell you that they didn't see anything. Always.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Nice Location, Recommende with Reservations”
Reviews.Author: aades
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Old Montreal and St. Denis. Nice room for the price. The downfall was not having parking. We parked at Place des Artes and the parking attendant rolled us. She charged us $15 when we entered and when we left a different attendant charged the same. The sign says $15 a day and we were there for less than 24 hours, worse yet there were not in-and-out privileges. When we left the second attendant did not speak English well and we had to go along with what he said to get out of there. We walked mostly everywhere but we didn't want to leave the car on the street near the 24 hr. sex clubs and prostitutes. Next time I might opt for a hotel with parking included.

Reviews.Title: “Like college again”
Reviews.Author: Joanie881
Reviews.Content: What a funny room, total dorm feel with cheap furniture and spartan look. That said, the location was great, AC worked well and no complaints. Personnel were helpful esp.via email when I was booking. It was nice being 5 min from Old Montreal and 5 min from the silly main drag of St. Laurent. Plus the Metro was close and walking in general was easy. A fair amount of sleaziness in the area but that doesn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly situated hotel which offers good, clean, basic rooms to a low cost”
Reviews.Author: denim69
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic with a student dorm feeling. The hotel has a friendly staff, free high speed internet (don't forget to bring a cable), nice clean bathrooms and a great location in down-town Montreal. The hotel has no restaurant, but the rooms have a small kitchenette of good quality which is perfect for preparing breakfast and other small meals. There is a food store rather close, ~250m, and China town is just across the street from the hotel which offers many great restaurants. In summary, next time I visit Montreal I would gladly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service, Central and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Roze_Elle
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, as well as my best friend and her boyfriend went to this hotel for the Victoria long weekend to sightsee and party. ROOMS Besides having to use a single bed for two people, the room was just right. It was very clean and we had an awesome view of the city (specifically Chinatown and the taller buildings near Old Montreal). The room had a mini kitchen (stove, microwave and fridge) with cutlery and pots/dishes which was very convenient for us since we wanted to save money by eating in. There is also a Mac's convenient store downstairs and an IGA grocery store half a block away where you can buy food also. There is a nice terrace on the 5th floor where you can smoke and simply hang out. With the beautiful weather this weekend, we were on there a lot having a smoke, a drink, and playing cards (since there are tables and chairs too). Note, there are only TWO elevators which can both be slow at times. If you are impatient when it comes to waiting for an elevator, suggest for a lower floor or at least floor 5 or 7 (trust me/// once you're there, you'll know why). BOOKING My boyfriend and I had booked a Studio A room with a single bed and thought we could request for a room with 2 single beds (to make it into a double bed). Unfortunately, we were unable to get a room with 2 single beds because the hotel was fully booked. My ADVICE is when you're booking online MAKE SURE you are aware of what kind of bed is given to you especially if you're not travelling alone! However we managed to stay in a room with the single bed, and for the price, we thought it was a good value. SERVICE The front desk staff were very accomodating, helpful, and friendly. I've stayed in many hotels (franchise ones too) and this concierge staff was probably the best I've ever encountered with. They were very understanding and considerate. You knew that they genuinely wanted to make your stay the most confortable and pleasant experience. They answered questions with care and tried their hardest to accomodate to any request we made. Their service went above and beyond e,specially for a 2 star hotel. LOCATION It is right across from Montreal's Chinatown and about a 10 min walk from the Old Port. It is on St. Laurent Ave which has a lot of strip clubs and bars/clubs around. It is very close to the busy streets such as St. Catherines and Crescent St. If you want to party and be close to the parties, this place is a good location for that. It is also close to tourist areas. THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE BUILDING. The closest and SAFEST parking is about half a block away in an underground which isn't free either. One warning about this location is that there are a lot of panhandlers that hang around this area, but they seemed harmless for the most part. OVERALL I would go back to this hotel if I planned to go to Montreal again because of the value, the very central location to downtown, and for the customer service. Overall, I give this hotel 2 thumbs up but then again Im not super picky either. =P

Reviews.Title: “its perfect for what we needed it for”
Reviews.Author: spermie100
Reviews.Content: First of all to TorontoKev... you gave a bad review to the hotel because of a stupid spider????? Reviews like yours should be scratched from the board cause quite honestly, you've wasted 2 minutes of my time making me read it when really I learned that you know nothing about travelling. NOW; threw a bachelor party with 20 or so friends, rooms are spacey, kitchens, one had a view. Were they the cleanest. I dont know, they looked fine to me. Staff was helpful in pointing us in the right directions for bars and places to go. OVERALL, its all good... i even let the big tarantula like spider in for a quick drink.

Reviews.Title: “Clean well-located basic apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmcguire64
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Basic dorm-like modern room with Ikea-style furniture and cooking facilities including fridge, microwave oven, 2 burner cooktop, kitchen sink, pots, plates, cups, utensils. LCD TV. Wired internet (free; wire supplied if you need it.) Spotlessly clean; lino floors. Incredible view of Montreal from 12th floor. Small grocery shop on ground floor; restaurants nearby; IGA grocery store in large indoor mall a few blocks away. Room was quiet; almost no street noise; however, room was small and there was not much lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - no frills”
Reviews.Author: Procrastinasian
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel and the lobby are much nicer than the appearance of the rooms themselves. They have a very college dorm-like feeling to them. Our room smelled faintly of smoke when we walked in, but we were tired and didn't want to make a fuss and request a room change. The bathroom was large, but the shower seemed kind of old. I liked the kitchenette - it was nice having the basic dishes, stovetop, microwave, and minifridge all supplied. The TV was also nice. For what we paid, the hotel was fine, but I'd been hoping for something better. It's very close to a sketchy part of town with lots of adult entertainment. If I'd been traveling alone, i would have felt uncomfortable walking around at night.

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: holga87
Reviews.Content: Found Le Rene Levesque on Trip Advisor and despite some bad reviews booked it for 4 days for me and 4 of my friends.
